Do some final polishing of the scrubbed mason analysis data.

Source: R/scrub.R
polish.Rd

Do some final polishing of the scrubbed mason analysis data.

polish_renaming(data, renaming.fun, columns = NULL)

polish_filter(data, keep.pattern, column)

polish_transform_estimates(data, transform.fun)

polish_adjust_pvalue(data, method = "BH")

Arguments

data

The scrubbed object.
renaming.fun

A function, typically with base::gsub(), that searches and replaces strings.
columns

The columns to apply the renaming function to. Defaults to columns that are a factor or character vectors.
keep.pattern

Rows to keep based on a regular expression pattern.
column

The column to apply the filtering to.
transform.fun

A function to modify continuous variable columns.
method

Correction method for the p-value adjustment (stats::p.adjust()).

Functions

  • polish_renaming: polish_renaming simply takes a function, most likely one that uses base::gsub(), and uses that to search and replace words, etc, in the specified columns.

  • polish_filter: polish_filter is basically a thin wrapper around dplyr::filter(), but using base::grepl() for the pattern searching.

  • polish_transform_estimates: polish_transform_estimates is simply a thin wrapper around dplyr::mutate_at().

  • polish_adjust_pvalue: polish_adjust_pvalue is a thin wrapper around dplyr::mutate() and stats::p.adjust()

Examples

library(magrittr)
ds <- swiss %>%
 design('glm') %>%
 add_settings() %>%
 add_variables('yvar', c('Fertility', 'Education')) %>%
 add_variables('xvar', c('Agriculture', 'Catholic')) %>%
 add_variables('covariates', 'Examination') %>%
 construct() %>%
 scrub()
polish_renaming(ds, function(x) gsub('Education', 'Schooling', x))
#> # A tibble: 12 x 10
#>    Yterms Xterms term  estimate std.error statistic  p.value conf.low conf.high
#>    <chr>  <chr>  <chr>    <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
#>  1 Schoo… Agric… (Int…   7.72      5.45        1.42 1.63e- 1  -2.95     18.4   
#>  2 Schoo… Agric… <-Xt…  -0.128     0.0598     -2.14 3.76e- 2  -0.245    -0.0110
#>  3 Schoo… Agric… Exam…   0.591     0.170       3.47 1.16e- 3   0.258     0.925 
#>  4 Schoo… Catho… (Int… -10.5       3.30       -3.20 2.56e- 3 -17.0      -4.08  
#>  5 Schoo… Catho… <-Xt…   0.0845    0.0275      3.07 3.70e- 3   0.0305    0.138 
#>  6 Schoo… Catho… Exam…   1.09      0.144       7.60 1.52e- 9   0.812     1.38  
#>  7 Ferti… Agric… (Int…  94.6       7.83       12.1  1.41e-15  79.3     110.    
#>  8 Ferti… Agric… <-Xt…  -0.0940    0.0859     -1.09 2.80e- 1  -0.262     0.0744
#>  9 Ferti… Agric… Exam…  -1.20      0.245      -4.89 1.40e- 5  -1.67     -0.716 
#> 10 Ferti… Catho… (Int…  83.0       4.98       16.7  1.21e-20  73.3      92.8   
#> 11 Ferti… Catho… <-Xt…   0.0418    0.0416      1.01 3.20e- 1  -0.0397    0.123 
#> 12 Ferti… Catho… Exam…  -0.886     0.217      -4.08 1.88e- 4  -1.31     -0.460 
#> # ... with 1 more variable: sample.size <int>
polish_filter(ds, 'Xterm', 'term')
#> # A tibble: 4 x 10
#>   Yterms  Xterms  term  estimate std.error statistic p.value conf.low conf.high
#>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>    <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1 Educat… Agricu… <-Xt…  -0.128     0.0598     -2.14 0.0376   -0.245    -0.0110
#> 2 Educat… Cathol… <-Xt…   0.0845    0.0275      3.07 0.00370   0.0305    0.138 
#> 3 Fertil… Agricu… <-Xt…  -0.0940    0.0859     -1.09 0.280    -0.262     0.0744
#> 4 Fertil… Cathol… <-Xt…   0.0418    0.0416      1.01 0.320    -0.0397    0.123 
#> # ... with 1 more variable: sample.size <int>
polish_adjust_pvalue(ds)[c('p.value', 'adj.p.value')]
#> # A tibble: 12 x 2
#>     p.value adj.p.value
#>       <dbl>       <dbl>
#>  1 1.63e- 1    1.96e- 1
#>  2 3.76e- 2    5.01e- 2
#>  3 1.16e- 3    2.32e- 3
#>  4 2.56e- 3    4.39e- 3
#>  5 3.70e- 3    5.55e- 3

#>  7 1.41e-15    8.48e-15
#>  8 2.80e- 1    3.05e- 1
#>  9 1.40e- 5    4.20e- 5
#> 10 1.21e-20    1.45e-19
#> 11 3.20e- 1    3.20e- 1
#> 12 1.88e- 4    4.52e- 4
polish_transform_estimates(ds, function(x) exp(x))
#> # A tibble: 12 x 10
#>    Yterms Xterms term  estimate std.error statistic  p.value conf.low conf.high

#>  1 Educa… Agric… (Int… 2.26e+ 3    232.        1.42 1.63e- 1 5.21e- 2  9.77e+ 7
